paragraphs.text: Gretchen Rubin, author of bestselling book The Happiness Project and habit expert at Harvard Business Review, found that this “winners don’t quit” mentality probably won’t work for your reading habit.
paragraphs.name: 6c11
37f9
paragraphs.text: Science shows that sharing your intentions with others when you’re working toward a task or goal can backfire, and make you less likely to succeed.
2. There are hidden minutes everywhere.
paragraphs.name: 6f9d

paragraphs.text: 2. There are hidden minutes everywhere.
paragraphs.name: 6f9d
a9b3
paragraphs.text: As Parisha put it, “There are minutes hidden in all the corners of the day, and they add up to a lot of minutes.” I’m not saying you should whip out a novel at your Sister’s wedding ceremony, but there are small opportunities to read nearly everywhere.

b24b6a083e28.title: I’m going to put this into practice as I should definitely read a lot more than I currently do.

paragraphs.text: I’m going to put this into practice as I should definitely read a lot more than I currently do.
paragraphs.name: 9b95

dc3c2a08bd26.title: Another tip for those with little time is to try and read 15–20 pages a day.

paragraphs.text: Another tip for those with little time is to try and read 15–20 pages a day. You will be surprised how many book you can read like this.
paragraphs.name: 2e46

paragraphs.text: 300 pages / 15 pages a day = 1 book in roughly 20 days. Which is roughly 18 books per year. If you read more pages per day, then more books per year.
paragraphs.name: d83d

paragraphs.text: Small steps lead to accomplished goals.
paragraphs.name: 502f

virtuals.subtitle: 300 pages / 15 pages a day = 1 book in roughly 20 days. Which is roughly 18 books per year. If you read more pages per day, then more books…

80ee3135105f.title: That’s a great tip, thanks Arthur Jan!

paragraphs.text: That’s a great tip, thanks Arthur Jan!
paragraphs.name: bc82

paragraphs.text: Great article! I really like the Hidden Minutes Everywhere section. So many people “don’t have the time,” but they have the time to watch a whole Netflix series, or spend hours on Facebook or Instagram. It’s more about prioritizing your time, not lack of time.
paragraphs.name: de96

paragraphs.text: I find setting goals, and already having a new book lined up helps me stay on track of my one book per week goal.
paragraphs.name: 05fb

virtuals.subtitle: I find setting goals, and already having a new book lined up helps me stay on track of my one book per week goal.

content.subtitle: I find setting goals, and already having a new book lined up helps me stay on track of my one book per week goal.

2e10927b1813.title: This seemed counterintuitive to me as well, but looking back at my own life I do remember telling…

paragraphs.text: This seemed counterintuitive to me as well, but looking back at my own life I do remember telling people about big goals that I was working on because I wanted some external pressure to hold me accountable. The problem is the vagueness, or being too general. I would say it like I already did it, and of course that ends up backfiring. So now I mostly…
paragraphs.name: fcf7

3b17174bd7ba.title: I just have to say ‘Thank you’ for saying it out loud-“Accept that it’s okay to quit.”

paragraphs.text: I just have to say ‘Thank you’ for saying it out loud-“Accept that it’s okay to quit.” I always knew this that quitting a book won’t make me a loser but I just couldn’t face the fact that I am going to quit on a book I started.
paragraphs.name: aad5

paragraphs.text: It always feels like I am going to miss something incredible if I don’t complete it.
paragraphs.name: 270f

virtuals.subtitle: It always feels like I am going to miss something incredible if I don’t complete it.

content.subtitle: It always feels like I am going to miss something incredible if I don’t complete it.

paragraphs.text: That’s very well put Jess and I completely agree!
paragraphs.name: afc2

b34cf8048004.title: Thanks for sharing that tip Kevin Saitta!

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing that tip Kevin Saitta!

d7d0b8bea9f7.title: Hi Elle, great piece of writing !

paragraphs.text: Hi Elle, great piece of writing ! An extra tip which I use a lot : audiobooks and Audible. Especially useful when walking your dog for instance ! Only downside is that this can get expensive if you wish to have a hard copy as well
paragraphs.name: 08e3

paragraphs.text: Quite a handy article! One of the struggles of adult life is carving out a few minutes or even an hour to read a good book. Life gets so busy and you feel tired but when I actually sit down to read a few pages of a physical book, I find that I feel refreshed and mentally energized. Thank you so much for sharing!
paragraphs.name: 9ca9

paragraphs.text: Awesome article! You hit the nail on the head. I carry a book with me everywhere I go, and having done so for a few years now I can say with certainty you’d be surprised just how many “hidden minutes” there are. Even if I only read for a fifteen minute period twice a day throughout my work day, it helps keep my mind balanced and stress down. Thanks for sharing!
paragraphs.name: 4b64

cedb72283c4c.title: That seems counterintuitive! Did you mean the opposite?

paragraphs.text: That seems counterintuitive! Did you mean the opposite?
paragraphs.name: 1f8e

bdda78ee81ae.title: I’ve learned to quit books often and early.

paragraphs.text: I’ve learned to quit books often and early. I’m very choosey when I select a book, looking at reviews and what friends recommend (from FB and Goodreads). Even still, I abandon about 10–20% of books within the first hour of reading.

c119770d1adc.title: Great idea for a future article Glen Binger, thanks!

paragraphs.text: Great idea for a future article Glen Binger, thanks!
paragraphs.name: 1ee4

8d647d3b715b.title: I agree — it helps to have a flip phone.

paragraphs.text: I agree — it helps to have a flip phone. (I do have a tablet for when I need to be mobile, but that limits me to using it in places with wifi.) So I read books in waiting rooms, on public transportation, etc. I was at a busy DMV the other day, and I was the ONLY one with a book. When I do have the tablet on me, it is a strong temptation. Amazing.
paragraphs.name: c7f7

cf6205dfc9b9.title: This should be something everyone should be aware of.

paragraphs.text: This should be something everyone should be aware of. Time management isn’t just about having a great calendar, its about using all of the available time productively.
paragraphs.name: e8a1

paragraphs.text: No Boris Pan — it does seem strange, but the research essentially found that you’re tricking your brain into thinking you’ve already accomplished the goal when you share it with others, and thus destroying any willpower to move forward with it.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for your excellent article and the link to HBR article. For me, limiting time on social networks was what contributed the most to reading more books. I used to be an avid reader but a couple years back I noticed I’m not reading nearly as much as I used to. I decided to reduce the Reddit groups, limit my time on Twitter and to outright quit…
